Posts.EditableText: Well, I've gone and made a sequel to The Mansion. I've uploaded it, just waiting for it to be added to the archive. Hope you all like it!
Posts.HTML: Well, I've gone and made a sequel to The Mansion. I've uploaded it, just waiting for it to be added to the archive. Hope you all like it!

Posts.EditableText: http://www.axeuk.com/quest/games/mansion2.zip "The sequel to The Mansion sees you kidnapped by the mysterious corporation responsible for your uncle's death and held in a dingy prison cell. Can you escape the prison? Can you bring the corporation to justice? Can you avenge your uncle? Find out in this sequel of epic proportions!" Please post any reviews, comments, requests for help etc. to this thread.
Posts.HTML:
http://www.axeuk.com/quest/games/mansion2.zip

"The sequel to The Mansion sees you kidnapped by the mysterious corporation responsible for your uncle's death and held in a dingy prison cell. Can you escape the prison? Can you bring the corporation to justice? Can you avenge your uncle? Find out in this sequel of epic proportions!"

Please post any reviews, comments, requests for help etc. to this thread.

Posts.EditableText:
Mansion II

Wow.  A very interesting and sometimes complex game.  I thoroughly enjoy the details like the maps and the potions.  Putting the computer together was awesome.  Iâ€™m going to brag that I put it together without cheating.  Basic computer hardware knowledge is actually helpful there.
The torture items were a bit eerie but an interesting puzzle.  
I havenâ€™t had time to play through the entire game but the first part of the game is almost flawless and very playable.  You make mention at the beginning of the game or the faq (I forget where now) that you designed it to be more playable by clicking on the items, etc.  You did a good job with that.
To be honest, I found one error so far.  It was quite minor but I did notice it.  In the cell at the beginning, if you take the cot, find the grille, solve the puzzle on opening the grilleâ€¦..you leave the room and if you return, the cot can be moved again to reveal the grille again as if you had never seen it before.
That is the only error I can recall.  
It wasn't exactly like playing the first Mansion game and playing the first Mansion game is not required to enjoy this one.
I score this puppy a:
[b:jjncqmey]5 out of 5[/b:jjncqmey]

EDIT:
I completed the game.  It is pretty good and it is compelling.  I found a couple more errors but it was less than a handful.  Since the intro to the game indicates that this was designed to utilize the inventory block, in other words, more mouse-friendly, I did not hold it against the author that certain details were not addressed in the rooms.  For example, a room would describe that ivy is growing and there is a broken chair in the room.  The available objects to interact with are the ivy and a broken chair leg.  If you decide to type in commands and say â€œlook at chairâ€, there is no chair.
In regular text games that would count against the score in my opinion.  I may play this again and see if I can go through it without typing anything at all.  I have a feeling that I can.

Posts.EditableText: Edit: Never mind my first ?. I figured it out. However, I've got another one! I'm stuck in the house. I've put the fossil on the mantle of the fireplace, the plant under running water in the sink, the duck in the basement, but when I try to light the candle in the dark bathroom, no luck. In fact, I've tried lighting it in every room, and no soap. I understand I have to light it somewhere dark, but where, if not the bathroom? It's a great game. There are some features that are a little annoying, but no big deal. Fr'instance, it would be nice if you could type "take all" instead of typing "take a", "take b", etc. when there are more than one or two things to take. It could just not let you take what's bolted to the ground, etc.. Also, it would be nice if you could type "l map" instead of having to type "l Security Map 001". It could just ask you which map to l at (1. 001, 2. 002, etc.). When you mix the chemicals, if you type "use red with flask", instead of using the red chemical, you get a list of the chemicals, and are asked which one you want to use. Again, minor matters. What a fun game! Thanks for making it.
Posts.HTML:

What a fun game! Thanks for making it.
